citeinfo.title: Alaska, Russian Salmon Getting Smaller - Alaska Sea Grant Radio Show

descript.abstract: As biologists and fishermen search for the cause of Western Alaska salmon declines, scientists say the state's Yukon River chum salmon are getting smaller. What's more, it seems to be a trend affecting salmon returning to at least one river in Russia as well. Doug Schneider has more in this week's Arctic Science Journeys Radio.
descript.purpose:
Chum salmon returning to Alaska's Yukon River and the Anadyr River in Russia have gotten steadily smaller since the 1960s. That's the conclusion drawn from a study of salmon growth done by state, university and federal researchers.
Bill Smoker, a fisheries scientist from the University of Alaska Fairbanks School of Fisheries and Ocean Sciences, announced the study's preliminary findings at a scientific conference in Fairbanks late last week.
